basics.title: Understanding Blood Donation
basics.whatIsBloodDonationContent: Blood donation is a voluntary procedure that can help save lives. There are several types of blood donation:

donationTypes.wholeDescription: The most common type of donation where we collect about a pint of whole blood.
donationTypes.plasmaDescription: Collects the liquid portion of blood that carries blood cells.
donationTypes.plateletsDescription: Collects platelets which help blood clot and are essential for cancer patients.

bloodTypes.title: Blood Types and Compatibility
bloodTypes.introduction: Understanding blood types is crucial for safe transfusions. There are 8 main blood types:

types.aPositive: A+: Can receive from A+, A-, O+, O-
types.aNegative: A-: Can receive from A-, O-
types.bPositive: B+: Can receive from B+, B-, O+, O-
types.bNegative: B-: Can receive from B-, O-
types.abNegative: AB-: Can receive from all negative types
types.oPositive: O+: Can receive from O+, O-

rhFactor.title: Rh Factor
rhFactor.description: The positive or negative sign after your blood type refers to the Rh factor. This is important for preventing complications during transfusions and pregnancy.

compatibility.title: Compatibility Chart
compatibility.description: Use this chart to understand which blood types are compatible for transfusions.

preparation.title: How to Prepare for Blood Donation

beforeDonation.title: Before Your Donation
beforeDonation.eat: Eat a healthy meal within 3 hours of donation
beforeDonation.iron: Eat iron-rich foods in the weeks before donation

dayOf.title: On Donation Day
dayOf.wear: Wear comfortable clothing with sleeves that roll up easily
dayOf.bring: Bring valid ID and list of medications
dayOf.schedule: Allow about an hour for the whole process

afterDonation.title: After Donation Care
afterDonation.bandage: Keep the bandage on for several hours

Welcome.title: Welcome to Blood Donors Community
Welcome.subtitle: Join our lifesaving mission to make blood donation accessible and efficient. Every drop counts in our journey to save lives together.

about.title: About Our Community
about.content: We are a dedicated network of volunteers, medical professionals, and community members working together to ensure a stable and safe blood supply. Since our establishment, we have helped thousands of patients through the generous contributions of our donors.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: To create a sustainable and efficient blood donation ecosystem that connects donors with those in need, while promoting awareness about the importance of regular blood donation.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.content: To build a world where no life is lost due to blood shortage, fostering a community where blood donation becomes a regular part of people's lives.

VirtualTest.title: Virtual Blood Type Test
VirtualTest.description: Answer a few questions to estimate your potential blood type

questions.parents: Do you know your parents' blood types?
questions.antibodies: Have you ever had a blood test before?

parents: One has type A, one has type B
antibodies: Yes, I know my blood type

tooltips.question: This helps us estimate your blood type based on genetic factors

result.title: Your Estimated Blood Type
result.description: Based on your answers, your blood type is likely:
result.disclaimer: This is only an estimate. Please get a professional blood test for accurate results.

bloodTypes.APositive: You can donate to A+ and AB+. You can receive from A+, A-, O+ and O-.
bloodTypes.ANegative: You can donate to A+, A-, AB+ and AB-. You can receive from A- and O-.
bloodTypes.BPositive: You can donate to B+ and AB+. You can receive from B+, B-, O+ and O-.
bloodTypes.BNegative: You can donate to B+, B-, AB+ and AB-. You can receive from B- and O-.
bloodTypes.OPositive: You can donate to O+, A+, B+ and AB+. You can receive from O+ and O-.
bloodTypes.ONegative: Universal donor - you can donate to all blood types. You can receive only from O-.
bloodTypes.ABPositive: Universal recipient - you can receive from all blood types. You can donate to AB+ only.
bloodTypes.ABNegative: You can donate to AB+ and AB-. You can receive from A-, B-, AB- and O-.

Privacy.title: Privacy Policy
Privacy.introduction: This Privacy Policy describes how Blood Donation Community ('we', 'our', or 'us') collects, uses, and shares your personal information when you use our website, mobile application, or services (collectively, the 'Services').
Privacy.commitment: We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal information. Please read this Privacy Policy carefully to understand our practices regarding your personal data.

information.title: Information We Collect
information.content: We collect several types of information from and about users of our Services, including:

personal.title: Personal Information
personal.content: Information that can be used to identify you, such as your name, email address, phone number, and location.
personal.examples: Name, email address, phone number, blood type, date of birth, gender, and location

usage.title: Usage Information
usage.content: Information about how you use our Services, including your browsing history, search queries, and interactions with our features.
usage.examples: Pages visited, time spent on pages, navigation paths, and features used

cookies.title: Cookies and Similar Technologies
cookies.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to collect information about your browsing activities and to personalize your experience on our Services.

use.title: How We Use Your Information
use.content: We use the information we collect for various purposes, including:

purposes.service: To provide and maintain our Services, including matching blood donors with recipients
purposes.improve: To improve and personalize your experience with our Services
purposes.communicate: To communicate with you about our Services, updates, and promotional offers
purposes.security: To ensure the security and integrity of our Services
purposes.legal: To comply with legal obligations and enforce our terms and policies

sharing.title: How We Share Your Information
sharing.content: We may share your information with third parties in the following circumstances:

thirdParties.title: Service Providers
thirdParties.content: We may share your information with third-party service providers who help us operate our Services, such as hosting providers, payment processors, and analytics providers.

legal.title: Legal Requirements
legal.content: We may disclose your information if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities (e.g., a court or government agency).

consent.title: With Your Consent
consent.content: We may share your information with third parties when you have given us your consent to do so, such as when you agree to connect with a blood recipient or donor.

security.title: Data Security
security.content: We take reasonable measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure. However, no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure. We implement various security measures to maintain the safety of your personal information, including:

measures.encryption: Using encryption to protect sensitive information transmitted online
measures.access: Limiting access to personal information to employees, contractors, and agents who need to know that information
measures.review: Regularly reviewing our information collection, storage, and processing practices
measures.servers: Maintaining physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards in connection with the collection, storage, and disclosure of personal information

rights.title: Your Rights and Choices
rights.content: Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information. These may include:

options.access: The right to access the personal information we have about you
options.correct: The right to correct inaccurate or incomplete information
options.delete: The right to delete your personal information
options.restrict: The right to restrict or object to our processing of your personal information
options.object: The right to object to automated decision-making

retention.title: Data Retention
retention.content: We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law. When determining how long to retain information, we consider the amount, nature, and sensitivity of the information, the potential risk of harm from unauthorized use or disclosure, and whether we can achieve the purposes of the processing through other means.

children.title: Children's Privacy
children.content: Our Services are not intended for children under the age of 16. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 16. If you are a parent or guardian and you believe your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us. If we become aware that we have collected personal information from children without verification of parental consent, we will take steps to remove that information from our servers.

changes.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.content: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the 'Effective Date' at the top of this Privacy Policy. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

Privacy.questions: If you have any questions or concerns about our Privacy Policy, please don't hesitate to contact us.

awareness.title: Awareness & Safety
awareness.description: Staying safe and avoiding fraud in blood donation

types.question: What are the different blood types?
types.answer: There are eight main blood types: A+, A-, B+, B-, AB+, AB-, O+, and O-. These types are determined by the presence or absence of certain antigens on the surface of red blood cells, as well as the Rh factor (positive or negative).

compatibility.question: Which blood types are compatible with each other?
compatibility.answer: Blood type compatibility is crucial for transfusions. Type O- is the universal donor (can donate to any blood type), while AB+ is the universal recipient (can receive from any blood type). Type A can donate to A and AB. Type B can donate to B and AB. Type AB can only donate to AB. Type O can donate to all types. The Rh factor (+ or -) also matters; Rh- can donate to both Rh+ and Rh-, but Rh+ can only donate to Rh+.

universal.question: Why is O- called the universal donor?
universal.answer: Type O negative blood is called the 'universal donor' because it lacks the A, B, and Rh antigens that could trigger an immune response in recipients. This means it can be safely transfused to patients of any blood type in emergency situations when there's no time to determine the recipient's blood type.

components.question: What are the main components of blood?
components.answer: Blood consists of four main components: 1) Red blood cells, which carry oxygen throughout the body; 2) White blood cells, which fight infection; 3) Platelets, which help blood clot; and 4) Plasma, the liquid portion of blood that contains water, salts, and proteins. Each component can be separated and used for different medical treatments.

shelfLife.question: How long can donated blood be stored?
shelfLife.answer: The shelf life of donated blood components varies: Red blood cells can be stored for up to 42 days at 6°C. Platelets can only be stored for 5-7 days at room temperature with constant agitation. Plasma can be frozen and stored for up to one year. This is why regular blood donations are essential to maintain adequate supplies.

eligible.question: Who is eligible to donate blood?
eligible.answer: Generally, blood donors must be at least 17 years old (16 with parental consent in some areas), weigh at least 50 kg (110 lbs), and be in good health. Donors should not have certain medical conditions, recent tattoos or piercings, or have traveled to certain regions. Specific eligibility criteria may vary by country and blood collection organization.

frequency.question: How often can I donate blood?
frequency.answer: For whole blood donation, you can typically donate once every 8-12 weeks (56-84 days). For platelet donation (apheresis), you may be able to donate more frequently, up to 24 times per year with at least 7 days between donations. Plasma donors can donate more frequently, typically every 28 days. These intervals allow your body to replenish the donated components.

process.question: What happens during the blood donation process?
process.answer: The blood donation process typically takes 45-60 minutes total, with the actual blood collection taking only 8-10 minutes. The process includes: 1) Registration and identification verification; 2) Health history questionnaire and mini-physical (temperature, pulse, blood pressure, and hemoglobin test); 3) The donation itself, where about 450-500 ml of blood is collected; and 4) Refreshments and a short rest period before leaving.

preparation.question: How should I prepare for blood donation?
preparation.answer: To prepare for blood donation: 1) Eat iron-rich foods in the weeks before donation; 2) Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water before and after donation; 3) Get a good night's sleep; 4) Eat a healthy meal 2-3 hours before donating; 5) Avoid fatty foods before donation; 6) Wear comfortable clothing with sleeves that can be rolled up; and 7) Bring identification and a list of medications you're taking.

after.question: What should I do after donating blood?
after.answer: After donating blood: 1) Rest for at least 15 minutes and have a snack and drink provided at the donation center; 2) Increase fluid intake for the next 24-48 hours; 3) Avoid strenuous physical activity, heavy lifting, or vigorous exercise for 24 hours; 4) Don't smoke for at least 2 hours; 5) Keep the bandage on for several hours; 6) If you feel dizzy, lie down with your feet elevated; and 7) Contact the blood center if you develop any unusual symptoms.

benefits.question: Are there health benefits to donating blood?
benefits.answer: Yes, blood donation offers several potential health benefits: 1) Free health screening that can detect issues like high blood pressure; 2) Reduction in iron stores, which may lower the risk of heart disease; 3) Production of new blood cells, which may help your blood flow better; 4) Burning calories (about 650 calories per pint donated); and 5) Psychological benefits from helping others. However, blood donation should primarily be viewed as a way to help others rather than as a health intervention.

register.question: How do I register as a blood donor on your platform?
register.answer: To register as a blood donor on our platform: 1) Create an account by clicking 'Sign Up' and providing your email and password; 2) Complete your profile with personal information, including your blood type and contact details; 3) Fill out the health questionnaire to determine your eligibility; 4) Verify your identity and contact information; 5) Set your donation preferences and availability; and 6) Accept the terms and conditions. Once registered, you can update your profile and respond to donation requests.

request.question: How do I request blood through your platform?
request.answer: To request blood through our platform: 1) Create an account or log in; 2) Click on 'Request Blood' in the main menu; 3) Fill out the request form with patient details, blood type needed, quantity, location, and urgency; 4) Upload any supporting documents (doctor's prescription or hospital admission details); 5) Submit your request for verification; 6) Once verified, your request will be visible to potential donors in your area; 7) You'll receive notifications when donors respond to your request; and 8) Coordinate with the donor or our team to complete the donation process.

verify.question: How does your platform verify blood requests?
verify.answer: Our platform verifies blood requests through a multi-step process: 1) Document verification - we check medical documents, prescriptions, and hospital admission details; 2) Hospital confirmation - we may contact the hospital or medical facility to confirm the need; 3) Identity verification - we verify the identity of the requester through government ID and contact information; 4) Location verification - we confirm the location where blood is needed; and 5) Urgency assessment - we prioritize requests based on medical urgency. This process typically takes 1-4 hours depending on urgency and complexity.

notifications.question: How will I be notified about matching blood requests or donors?
notifications.answer: You'll receive notifications through multiple channels: 1) In-app notifications within our platform; 2) Email alerts sent to your registered email address; 3) SMS text messages for urgent matches (if you've opted in); 4) WhatsApp messages (if you've connected your account); and 5) Push notifications on your mobile device if you've installed our app. You can customize your notification preferences in your account settings to receive only the alerts that are most important to you.

data.question: What personal data do you collect and store?
data.answer: We collect and store several types of personal data: 1) Identity information (name, date of birth, gender); 2) Contact information (email, phone number, address); 3) Medical information (blood type, medical history relevant to donation eligibility); 4) Location data (to match donors with nearby recipients); 5) Account credentials (username, password); 6) Donation history; and 7) Device and usage information when you use our platform. We only collect information that is necessary to provide our services and comply with medical and safety regulations.

sharing.question: Who do you share my information with?
sharing.answer: We share your information only with: 1) Matched donors/recipients (only necessary contact information to facilitate donation); 2) Healthcare providers and blood banks involved in the donation process; 3) Service providers who help operate our platform (with strict confidentiality agreements); 4) Legal authorities when required by law; and 5) Emergency contacts you've designated. We never sell your personal information to third parties or share it for marketing purposes without your explicit consent.

delete.question: How can I delete my account and data?
delete.answer: To delete your account and data: 1) Log in to your account; 2) Go to 'Account Settings'; 3) Select 'Privacy & Data'; 4) Click on 'Delete My Account'; 5) Follow the verification process to confirm your identity; 6) Select which data you want to delete (you can choose to maintain donation records for medical purposes while deleting personal information); 7) Confirm deletion. Please note that some information may be retained for legal and regulatory compliance, but will no longer be used for operational purposes.

security.question: How do you protect my personal information?
security.answer: We protect your personal information through: 1) Encryption of sensitive data both in transit and at rest; 2) Secure servers with advanced firewall protection; 3) Regular security audits and vulnerability testing; 4) Strict access controls limiting who can view your information; 5) Staff training on data protection and privacy; 6) Two-factor authentication for account access; 7) Anonymization of data used for research or analytics; and 8) Compliance with international data protection standards and regulations. We regularly update our security measures to address emerging threats.

fraud.question: What are common blood donation scams I should be aware of?
fraud.answer: Common blood donation scams include: 1) Fake emergency requests that create urgency to bypass verification; 2) Financial scams requesting payment for 'processing fees' or 'transportation'; 3) Identity theft schemes that collect excessive personal information; 4) Impersonation of hospitals or blood banks; 5) Fake blood donation drives that collect donations for non-existent patients; 6) Phishing attempts through fake blood donation websites or apps; and 7) Social media scams with emotional stories but no verifiable details. Always verify requests through official channels and never send money to unverified requesters.

verify.question: How can I verify if a blood request is legitimate?
verify.answer: To verify a blood request's legitimacy: 1) Check if the request comes through our verified platform; 2) Look for hospital documentation with letterhead, doctor's name, and contact information; 3) Call the hospital directly using a number from their official website (not the one provided in the request); 4) Ask for specific details about the patient's condition and blood needs; 5) Be wary of requests that only provide mobile numbers or refuse hospital verification; 6) Check if the requester has a complete profile with verification badges; and 7) Report suspicious requests to our platform immediately.

report.question: How do I report suspicious activity or potential fraud?
report.answer: To report suspicious activity: 1) Use the 'Report' button on any request or profile page; 2) Select the type of suspicious activity from the dropdown menu; 3) Provide details about why you believe it's fraudulent; 4) Upload any evidence you have (screenshots, communications); 5) Submit the report for our team to investigate; 6) For urgent concerns, contact our support team directly through the 'Contact Us' page or emergency hotline; 7) You can also email evidence to our dedicated fraud prevention team at report@blooddonationcommunity.org. All reports are kept confidential and investigated promptly.

community.question: How does community awareness help prevent fraud?
community.answer: Community awareness prevents fraud through: 1) Collective vigilance where donors share information about suspicious patterns; 2) Education about common scams and red flags; 3) Peer verification where community members can vouch for legitimate requests; 4) Rapid reporting of suspicious activity; 5) Sharing of verified donation experiences; 6) Community-led awareness campaigns; and 7) Support networks that help connect people with verified donation channels. Our platform facilitates this community awareness through verified reviews, community forums, and educational resources.

platform.title: Our Blood Donation Platform
platform.description: Blood Need is a community-driven platform dedicated to connecting blood donors with recipients in need. We believe that every donation has the potential to save lives, and our mission is to make the process as simple and efficient as possible.

features.1: Real-time matching of donors with recipients based on blood type and location
features.2: Secure and private communication between donors and recipients
features.3: Emergency alerts for urgent blood requirements
features.4: Educational resources about blood donation and health

platform.imageCaption: Every donation can save up to three lives

bio.title: About Me
bio.content: I'm Rana Arju, a passionate Full Stack Web Developer with expertise in MERN stack development. I specialize in creating responsive, user-friendly web applications that solve real-world problems.
bio.content2: With a strong foundation in both front-end and back-end technologies, I enjoy building complete solutions from concept to deployment. The 'Blood Need' platform represents my commitment to using technology for social good.
